Description: Lip and wall sherd (mended from three fragments, including 1886,0401.803) of East Greek (North Ionian) pottery lotus bowl; fine orange clay with some silver mica; glaze fired orange-brown; interior glazed with added red band lined in white; exterior: top of lip glazed; in frieze, set of verticals, large dot, lotus pendent lotus flower; glaze traces below; inscription cut on exterior.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 297)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 668, no. 258)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.585)
